text:
Hello <@UFBDBKQ1H>
It’s working perfectly ! :+1:
My CRM card fetch my heroku url => Done!
It’s possible to fetch a dynamic url ? with different ID ? for example : <https://my-app.herokuapp.com/1> or /2 for display different content associate with contact ?
Thanks for your Help :wink:
Hello guys, Is there any API to create conversation?
Hi guys, Is I am doing anything wrong ?

this is tricky, ticket forms are supported in a weird way. change the Ticket properties from:
• `content` to `TICKET.content` 
• `subject` to `TICKET.subject`
and also add as a parameter: `skipValidation=true`
keep `email` as it is as it is a Contact property

<@UFEMNG3RA> Jumping in for Rahmona since she is out today.  Can you tell me a bit more about what determines the ID you want to have in the URL? What’s the use case you are trying to accomodate in the CRM card?

Hello <@UFBNA9K9A>
I would like fetch different show/Json _Contact_ object of my <http://Rails.app|Rails.app>
Many thanks

So the contact Id is part of the query string depending on which contact is being loaded. IJt won’t be part of the path as you have in the example above but it will look more like this `<https://my-app.herokuapp.com?contactId=2>`

more than : <https://my-app.herokuapp.com/?contact/2>
currently, i send the same data to all contacts

`{`
  `"submittedAt": "1576238992000",` 
  `"fields": [`
    `{`
      `"name": "email",`
      `"value": "<mailto:stayduvetcontactstesting@gmail.com|stayduvetcontactstesting@gmail.com>"`
    `},`
    `{`
      `"name": "TICKET.subject",`
      `"value": "This is test from API"`
    `},`
    `{`
      `"name": "TICKET.content",`
      `"value": "This is test from API"`
    `}`
  `]`
`}`
<@U7SL518D6> Should this be added to docs?
<@URC2M9CAV> that looks correct. Remember to skip validation with the request parameter.
Sorry, <@UDU6KEBFB>. I missed your posts. Where are you thinking of putting the `OR` parameters?
